io.github.robolib.module.iface

Class Relay

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.github.robolib.module.iface.Interface
      • io.github.robolib.module.iface.Relay
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Module

    public final class Relay
extends Interface
implements Module
    Class for VEX Robotics Spike style relay outputs. Relays are intended to be connected to Spikes or similar relays. The relay channels controls a pair of pins that are either both off, one on, the other on, or both on. This translates into two Spike outputs at 0v, one at 12v and one at 0v, one at 0v and the other at 12v, or two Spike outputs at 12V. This allows off, full forward, or full reverse control of motors without variable speed. It also allows the two channels (forward and reverse) to be used independently for something that does not care about voltage polarity (like a solenoid).
    Author:
    Austin Reuland

    • Method Detail

      • free

      • set

        public void set(boolean value)
        Parameters:

      • set

        public void set(Relay.RelayValue value)
        Set the relay state. Valid values depend on which directions of the relay are controlled by the object. When set to Relay.RelayDirection.BOTH, the relay can be set to any of the four states: 0v-0v, 12v-0v, 0v-12v, 12v-12v When set to FORWARD or REVERSE, you can specify the constant for the direction or you can simply specify OFF and ON. Using only OFF and ON is recommended.
        Parameters:
        value - The state to set the relay.

      • get

        public Relay.RelayValue get()
        Get the Relay State Gets the current state of the relay. When set to FORWARD or REVERSE, value is returned as ON/OFF not FORWARD/REVERSE (per the recommendation in Set)
        Returns:
        The current state of the relay as a Relay.RelayValue

      • setDirection

        public void setDirection(Relay.RelayDirection dir)
        Set the Relay Direction Changes which values the relay can be set to depending on which direction is used Valid inputs are FORWARD, REVERSE, and BOTH
        Parameters:
        dir - The direction for the relay to operate in
